title: How is Barcelona growing in terms of economy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because of measures imposed on Catalonia by the Government in Madrid after the Catalans tried to hold a referendum in 2017 the economic growth slowed down a little, but because many countries around the world are very supportive of Catalonia, and Barcelona in particular, I understand that things are now back to normal. Barcelona, Vienna and Paris are the principal European cities that host international congresses and it is from that that Barcelona has gained so much fame. Madrid has spent many millions of Euros trying to attract congress tourism and has failed miserably. Barcelona also has the largest cruise port in the Mediterranean which can actually accommodate 15 cruise liners at the same time. Naturally it rarely needs to do so. Another factor is that around the world many people believe Barcelona is the capital of Spain, it is certainly more suited to it than is Madrid, is it much more cosmopolitan,
